feed.title: Blake Lively and Mom Slap Alleged Stalker With Restraining Order
feed.subtitle: Blake Lively and her mother Elaine have obtained a temporary restraining order against a man alleged to have followed the Gossip Girl star on set.

content.div:
Go ahead and follow Gossip Girl. (No judgment. In the blessed name of Dair, they could sure use the ratings.) Of course, we don't mean you should ever follow GG literally -- as in lurking around sets, stalking, and repeatedly phoning cast memberss mothers to check that everything's peachy.

That, kittens, will land you in court.

Take the situation that's recently plagued GG star Blake Lively. According to the New York Daily News, the actress and her mother, Elaine Lively, claim they've been repeatedly harassed by a Russian-born man named Sergei Mifle to the point of fearing for their safety. They obtained a temporary restraining order against him from the L.A. Superior Court yesterday, E! News reports.

According to the Daily News, Mifle, a New Jersey resident, had been spotted by Gossip Girl staffers "lurking" and "watching" Lively on set Feb. 1. "That day made me very nervous and afraid for my safety," the actress said in court docs obtained by the Daily News. "I am worried that Mifle might follow me around and harm me."

As for how the actress' mother fits into the story, Mifle is alleged to have repeatedly phoned and e-mailed Elaine, begging to talk to Blake and claiming he was going to somehow "help her heal" from her supposedly self-destructive ways. According to the court docs, Lively found at least one of Mifle's desperate-sounding VMs "threatening."

Under the restraining order, Mifle is not allowed within 100 yards of the TV star, her mom (or her pile of freebie Louboutins). E-mails and voice mail messages are also a no-no.

That said, he's still free to answer calls from the Daily News -- and as he told the paper, he's still eager to make contact with Lively. (They note that he’s not currently in treatment for mental health issues.)

"I don't want to get arrested. But the restraining order is ridiculous. I will stay away, but there will come a time when I'm going to need her. I just want to talk to her. I like her very much," he told the paper.

"I don't know her personally, but I know her, and I don't want to see her go the way of Lindsay Lohan. Her mind seems set on self-destruction."

According to E!, Lively's temporary restraining order will be in effect until a March 2 court date.

leahc@dose.ca
